name: Pythagorean trigonometric identity
explanation: The fundamental identity cos²A + sin²A = 1 relating the squares of sine and cosine of the same angle.

name: Sine rule for triangles
explanation: The formula relating the sides and angles of a triangle: a/sin A = b/sin B = c/sin C.

name: Cosine rule for triangles
explanation: The formula a² = b² + c² – 2bc cos A relating the lengths of sides of a triangle to the cosine of one angle.

name: Cosine of difference formula
explanation: The formula cos(A–B) = cos A cos B + sin A sin B expressing cosine of a difference of angles in terms of sines and cosines.

name: Cosine of sum formula
explanation: The formula cos(A+B) = cos A cos B – sin A sin B expressing cosine of a sum of angles in terms of sines and cosines.

name: Double angle formula for cosine
explanation: The formula cos 2A = cos² A – sin² A expressing cosine of double an angle in terms of squares of sine and cosine.

name: Sine of sum formula
explanation: The formula sin(A+B) = sin A cos B + cos A sin B expressing sine of a sum of angles in terms of sines and cosines.

name: Sine of difference formula
explanation: The formula sin(A–B) = sin A cos B – cos A sin B expressing sine of a difference of angles in terms of sines and cosines.

name: Tangent of sum formula
explanation: The formula tan(A+B) = (tan A + tan B) / (1 – tan A tan B) expressing tangent of a sum of angles in terms of tangents.

name: Tangent of difference formula
explanation: The formula tan(A–B) = (tan A – tan B) / (1 + tan A tan B) expressing tangent of a difference of angles in terms of tangents.

name: Double angle formula for sine
explanation: The formula sin 2A = 2 sin A cos A expressing sine of double an angle in terms of sine and cosine.

name: Alternative double angle formula for sine
explanation: The formula sin 2A = 2 tan A / (1 + tan² A) expressing sine of double an angle in terms of tangent.

name: Alternative double angle formula for cosine
explanation: The formula cos 2A = (1 – tan² A) / (1 + tan² A) expressing cosine of double an angle in terms of tangent.

name: Double angle formula for tangent
explanation: The formula tan 2A = 2 tan A / (1 – tan² A) expressing tangent of double an angle in terms of tangent.

name: Cosine squared in terms of cosine double angle
explanation: The formula cos² A = ½ (1 + cos 2A) expressing the square of cosine in terms of cosine of double angle.

name: Sine squared in terms of cosine double angle
explanation: The formula sin² A = ½ (1 – cos 2A) expressing the square of sine in terms of cosine of double angle.

name: Product to sum formula: 2 cos A cos B
explanation: The formula 2 cos A cos B = cos(A+B) + cos(A–B) expressing product of cosines as sum of cosines.

name: Product to sum formula: 2 sin A cos B
explanation: The formula 2 sin A cos B = sin(A+B) + sin(A–B) expressing product of sine and cosine as sum of sines.

name: Product to sum formula: 2 sin A sin B
explanation: The formula 2 sin A sin B = cos(A–B) – cos(A+B) expressing product of sines as difference of cosines.

name: Product to sum formula: 2 cos A sin B
explanation: The formula 2 cos A sin B = sin(A+B) – sin(A–B) expressing product of cosine and sine as difference of sines.

name: Sum to product formula: cos A + cos B
explanation: The formula cos A + cos B = 2 cos((A+B)/2) cos((A–B)/2) expressing sum of cosines as product of cosines.

name: Sum to product formula: cos A – cos B
explanation: The formula cos A – cos B = –2 sin((A+B)/2) sin((A–B)/2) expressing difference of cosines as product of sines.

name: Sum to product formula: sin A + sin B
explanation: The formula sin A + sin B = 2 sin((A+B)/2) cos((A–B)/2) expressing sum of sines as product of sine and cosine.

name: Sum to product formula: sin A – sin B
explanation: The formula sin A – sin B = 2 cos((A+B)/2) sin((A–B)/2) expressing difference of sines as product of cosine and sine.

name: Pythagorean Identity
explanation: The fundamental trigonometric identity stating that the square of cosine of an angle plus the square of sine of the same angle equals one, i.e., cos²A + sin²A = 1.

name: Sine Rule
explanation: A formula relating the lengths of sides of a triangle to the sines of its opposite angles, expressed as a/sin A = b/sin B = c/sin C.

name: Cosine Rule
explanation: A formula that relates the lengths of the sides of a triangle to the cosine of one of its angles, given by a² = b² + c² – 2bc cos A.

name: Half-Angle Formula for Cosine Squared
explanation: The identity expressing cos²A as ½ (1 + cos 2A).

name: Half-Angle Formula for Sine Squared
explanation: The identity expressing sin²A as ½ (1 – cos 2A).

name: Product-to-Sum Formula: 2 cos A cos B
explanation: The identity expressing 2 cos A cos B as cos(A+B) + cos(A–B).

name: Product-to-Sum Formula: 2 sin A cos B
explanation: The identity expressing 2 sin A cos B as sin(A+B) + sin(A–B).

name: Product-to-Sum Formula: 2 sin A sin B
explanation: The identity expressing 2 sin A sin B as cos(A–B) – cos(A+B).

name: Product-to-Sum Formula: 2 cos A sin B
explanation: The identity expressing 2 cos A sin B as sin(A+B) – sin(A–B).

name: Sum-to-Product Formula: cos A + cos B
explanation: The identity expressing cos A + cos B as 2 cos((A+B)/2) cos((A–B)/2).

name: Sum-to-Product Formula: cos A – cos B
explanation: The identity expressing cos A – cos B as –2 sin((A+B)/2) sin((A–B)/2).

name: Sum-to-Product Formula: sin A + sin B
explanation: The identity expressing sin A + sin B as 2 sin((A+B)/2) cos((A–B)/2).

name: Sum-to-Product Formula: sin A – sin B
explanation: The identity expressing sin A – sin B as 2 cos((A+B)/2) sin((A–B)/2).

name: Tangent double angle formula
explanation: The formula expressing tan 2A in terms of tan A: tan 2A = 2 tan A / (1 – tan² A).

name: Half-angle formulas
explanation: Formulas expressing squares of sine and cosine in terms of cosine of double angles, e.g., cos² A = ½ (1 + cos 2A), sin² A = ½ (1 – cos 2A).

name: Natural numbers (N)
explanation: The set of positive integers starting from 1, i.e., {1, 2, 3, 4, ...}, used for counting and ordering.

name: Integers (Z)
explanation: The set of whole numbers including positive numbers, zero, and negative numbers, i.e., {..., -3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3, ...}.

name: Rational numbers (Q)
explanation: Numbers that can be expressed as the quotient of two integers, where the denominator is not zero, including fractions and decimals with finite or repeating decimal expansions.

name: Representation of rational numbers as fractions, decimals, and percentages
explanation: Understanding that fractions, decimals (finite or repeating), and percentages are different forms representing the same rational number.

name: Addition of natural numbers
explanation: Combining two natural numbers to get their sum, with the result also a natural number.

name: Subtraction of natural numbers
explanation: Finding the difference between two natural numbers, where the result remains a natural number if the minuend is larger or equal to the subtrahend.

name: Multiplication of natural numbers
explanation: Repeated addition of a natural number a specified number of times, resulting in another natural number.

name: Division of natural numbers
explanation: Splitting a natural number into equal parts or groups, resulting in a quotient that may or may not be a natural number.

name: Extension of arithmetic operations to rational numbers

name: Addition of integers including negative numbers
explanation: Combining integers, including negative values, following rules that maintain arithmetic properties and real-world interpretations.

name: Subtraction of integers including negative numbers

name: Multiplication of integers including negative numbers
explanation: Multiplying integers, including negative values, following rules such as the product of two negatives is positive.

name: Division of integers including negative numbers
explanation: Dividing integers, including negative values, applying rules consistent with multiplication and division properties.

name: Properties of arithmetic operations: commutative law
explanation: The property that states the order of addition or multiplication does not affect the result (e.g., a + b = b + a).

name: Properties of arithmetic operations: associative law
explanation: The property that states the grouping of numbers in addition or multiplication does not affect the result (e.g., (a + b) + c = a + (b + c)).

name: Properties of arithmetic operations: distributive law
explanation: The property that multiplication distributes over addition or subtraction (e.g., a × (b + c) = a × b + a × c).

name: Order of operations including brackets
explanation: Rules that define the sequence in which arithmetic operations are performed to correctly evaluate expressions.

name: Number line representation of natural numbers

name: Number line representation of integers

name: Number line representation of rational numbers
explanation: Visual placement of rational numbers, including fractions and decimals, on a continuous number line.

name: Recognition of irrational numbers
explanation: Understanding numbers that cannot be expressed as a ratio of integers and have non-repeating, non-terminating decimal expansions.

name: Geometric construction of √2 and √3
explanation: Using geometric methods (e.g., right triangles) to construct lengths representing the square roots of 2 and 3.

name: Proof that √2 is irrational
explanation: A mathematical proof demonstrating that the square root of 2 cannot be expressed as a ratio of two integers.

name: Real numbers (R)
explanation: The set of all rational and irrational numbers, representing all points on the continuous number line.

name: Complex numbers (C) in rectangular form
explanation: Numbers expressed as a + ib, where a and b are real numbers and i is the imaginary unit with i² = -1.

name: Addition of complex numbers
explanation: Adding complex numbers by separately adding their real parts and imaginary parts.

name: Multiplication of complex numbers
explanation: Multiplying complex numbers using distributive property and the fact that i² = -1.

name: Complex conjugate
explanation: For a complex number a + ib, its conjugate is a - ib, reflecting the number across the real axis in the complex plane.

name: Calculation of complex conjugates of sums and products
explanation: Finding the conjugate of sums and products of complex numbers by applying conjugation to each term.

name: Argand diagram representation of complex numbers
explanation: Graphical representation of complex numbers as points or vectors in a plane with real and imaginary axes.

name: Modulus of a complex number
explanation: The distance of a complex number from the origin in the Argand diagram, calculated as √(a² + b²) for a + ib.

name: Decimal representation as special equivalent fractions
explanation: Understanding decimals as fractions with denominators that are powers of 10, strengthening place-value and fraction connections.

name: Factors and multiples in natural numbers
explanation: Factors are numbers that divide another number exactly; multiples are products of a number and an integer.

name: Prime numbers in natural numbers
explanation: Natural numbers greater than 1 that have no positive divisors other than 1 and themselves.

name: Prime factorization
explanation: Expressing a natural number as a product of its prime factors.

name: Scientific notation for positive rational numbers

name: Arithmetic operations on numbers in scientific notation

name: commutative property of addition
explanation: The property that states changing the order of addends does not change the sum: a + b = b + a.

name: commutative property of multiplication
explanation: The property that states changing the order of factors does not change the product: ab = ba.

name: associative property of addition
explanation: The property that states the way addends are grouped does not change the sum: (a + b) + c = a + (b + c).

name: associative property of multiplication
explanation: The property that states the way factors are grouped does not change the product: (ab)c = a(bc).

name: distributive property of multiplication over addition
explanation: The property that states a(b + c) = ab + ac, distributing multiplication across addition.

name: representing numbers in scientific notation
explanation: Expressing non-zero positive rational numbers in the form a × 10^n where 1 ≤ a < 10 and n is an integer.

name: calculating powers with integer exponents
explanation: Raising a base number to an integer exponent, including positive, zero, and negative exponents.

name: multiplication rule for indices
explanation: The rule that states a^p × a^q = a^(p+q) for the same base a and exponents p, q.

name: division rule for indices
explanation: The rule that states a^p ÷ a^q = a^(p−q) for the same base a and exponents p, q.

name: power of a power rule
explanation: The rule that states (a^p)^q = a^(pq) for base a and exponents p, q.

name: zero exponent rule
explanation: The rule that states a^0 = 1 for any non-zero base a.

name: negative exponent rule
explanation: The rule that states a^(-p) = 1 / a^p for non-zero base a and positive integer p.

name: power of a product rule
explanation: The rule that states (ab)^p = a^p × b^p for bases a, b and exponent p.

name: power of a quotient rule
explanation: The rule that states (a/b)^p = a^p / b^p for bases a, b and exponent p.

name: solving problems using index laws

name: logarithm product rule

name: logarithm quotient rule

name: logarithm power rule

name: logarithm of base and one

name: change of base formula for logarithms

name: proof by induction of simple inequalities
